bill_title: establish provisions for replacing certain names of geographic places that use offensive words or phrases.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to establish provisions for replacing certain names of geographic places that use offensive words or phrases. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That § 1-19C-1 be AMENDED: 1-19C-1. The Legislature finds that all geographic place names containing the term terms, squaw, or scalp, are offensive and insulting to all of South Dakota's people, and contrary to that people's shared history, and heritage. These All place names containing the term, squaw, have been replaced by names that reflect South Dakota's people, history, and heritage without resorting to harmful or offensive stereotypes, names, words, or phrases, and all place names containing the term, scalp, must be replaced likewise. The following geographic places in Gregory County containing the term, scalp, shall be replaced with the following names: (1) North Scalp Creek to XXXXXXXXXXXXXXX; (2) Scalp Butte to XXXXXXXXXXXXXX; (3) Scalp Creek Indian Site to XXXXXXXXXXXXXXX; (4) South Scalp Creek to XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX; and (5) South Scalp Creek Recreation Area to XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX. Any geographic places in this state containing the term, scalp, for which replacement names have not been provided under this section, must receive replacement names in accordance with the provisions of § 1-19C-2.1. All state and local government agencies shall make changes to maps and any other reference materials to reflect the changes provided in this chapter. The use of the term terms, squaw, or scalp, in whole or in part, is prohibited as a name for any geographic feature within this state.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
